name: CNN
text: "Race and racism is a reality that so many of us grow up learning to just deal with. But if we ever hope to move past it, it can't just be on people of color to deal with it," former first lady Michelle Obama said while speaking out on George Floyd's death https://t.co/lWU0Pngymi

name: CNN
text: As protesters gathered outside the White House on Friday night in Washington, DC, President Trump was taken to the building's underground bunker for a little under an hour, according to a White House official and a law enforcement source. https://t.co/hugtYRvcT8

name: CNN
text: Amid protests Friday night, President Trump was taken to the White House underground bunker for a little under an hour, according to a White House official and a law enforcement source. CNN's @MarquardtA reports. https://t.co/Tdu2joLPFd https://t.co/FBWXpoATGJ

name: CNN
text: "For once, Don't Do It. Don't pretend there's not a problem in America. Don't turn your back on racism..." Nike posted a video with messaging encouraging people to "For once, Don't Do It," a play on the brand's iconic slogan https://t.co/6PYwbjb1Hr

name: CNN
text:
A sheriff joined a protest in Flint, Michigan, after speaking with demonstrators who were met by police officers in riot gear, according to CNN affiliate WEYI.

"I want to make this a parade, not a protest," Genesee County Sheriff Chris Swanson said. https://t.co/zy6p5QbSLH https://t.co/1Cgce89VP1

name: CNN
text: "This past week has brought tragedy upon tragedy to our nation. ... But our President was mostly busy with other things," writes David Gergen for @CNNOpinion https://t.co/ImnmmlaGJS

name: CNN
text: "I am absolutely, devastatingly sorry for their loss. If I could do anything to bring Mr. Floyd back, I would do that. I would move heaven and Earth to do that." Minneapolis Police Chief Medaria Arradondo addresses the family of George Floyd live on CNN. https://t.co/tzZe64FaEp https://t.co/dOmRV6O7ZV

name: CNN
text: Two Atlanta police officers have been fired after a video showed them tasing a man and using excessive force on a woman https://t.co/UM2M5fzF0h

name: CNN
text:
“Black America knows the pain well, and the pain runs deep.”

CNN's @Ryanyoungnews tells the heartbreaking stories of just some of the black Americans who have died at the hands of police. https://t.co/7XkP3qQRH4 https://t.co/41r1DnP7Ch

name: CNN
text: Colin Kaepernick, along with his nonprofit Know Your Rights Camp, has started a Legal Defense Initiative to support protesters in Minneapolis who may need legal resources https://t.co/nnWTu24yhO

name: CNN
text:
"He should just stop talking... He speaks and he makes it worse. There are times when you should just be quiet." 

Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms rebuked President Trump over rhetoric she said is stoking racial tensions in the US. https://t.co/8mLZqtJ1OU

name: CNN
text: “If you look at this from 35,000 feet, this man died over $20. Really? … Why do you think people are so damn angry.” @sarasidnerCNN reflects on the events that led to George Floyd’s death. https://t.co/Rv2Erclw7a https://t.co/qTKjvG79s6

name: CNN
text:
"He didn't give me an opportunity to even speak." 

George Floyd's brother, Philonise Floyd, described how his conversation with Donald Trump went.

"It was hard...he just kept, like, pushing me off, like 'I don't want to hear what you're talking about.'" https://t.co/AytLf2Glje

name: CNN
text: In an emotional response to George Floyd's family Sunday night, the Minneapolis police chief says in his mind, all four officers involved in the black man's killing bear the same responsibility. https://t.co/beg1TzbMPK

name: CNN
text: Two Atlanta Police Department officers were fired Sunday after video showed them using "excessive force" against two college students during Saturday night's protests, Atlanta's mayor announced. https://t.co/eTRVBNAxEg

name: CNN
text: Under siege in the White House, President Donald Trump is aggravating America's latest racial anguish in a nation now simultaneously beset by violence-wracked cities, a deadly disease and staggering economic deprivation | Analysis by @StCollinson https://t.co/GI4V0p6wuO

name: CNN
text:
New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's daughter was arrested during protests Saturday night, according to police sources.

Chiara de Blasio was arrested for unlawful assembly and was later released. https://t.co/2CKQbXB5yp

text: Actor Kendrick Sampson said he was shot seven times with rubber bullets by police in Los Angeles on Saturday during a protest over the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/VzWICwUVI9

name: CNN
text:

Beyoncé demands change following the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/PMusW0QLrj

text: Michael Jordan on the death of George Floyd: 'We have had enough.' https://t.co/ShSq3uzSj4
